----------------------------------IT真實行情---------------------------------------
----------------廣告1: Cyber Universal Company Limited-------------------------

早前我去一間係尖沙咀,叫"Cyber Universal Company Limited. 新意環球有限公司"見programmer
問起我點解想離開上一間公司
我同佢講因為上一間公司成日開OT,令我好難半工讀到
佢竟然好串咁話:
我地間公司成日都做到8,9點架啦!!好多時星期六、日都要OT返工!!
你想準時放工去讀書?去做保安啦你!!
保安咪準時放工收工後乜都唔洗理囉!!
你走得架啦!!
轉行做保安啦!!
果刻火到拍枱起身走

你地日日開OT=好威同正常?
係你地管理同能力問題吓?
垃圾港資扮大牌!!
見佢地日日登jobsdb,繼續登多幾年jobsdb啦!!

------------------------------廣告2: Macroxxxw----------------------------------------------------
冇自己位不在話下, 但有勁污糟既位俾你用
男人去廁所要去出面熱到仆街既公廁，女人就有公司廁所
Director 加丁點人工 = 俾機會你進步
打工學野係要交學費
落左site做野唔係公司 = 你放緊假好撚得閒
7 x 24 oncall is a must
例牌要OT做野
Sales 不嬲當Enginee 仔狗咁撚,客一投訴就送呢樣送果樣俾佢, 務求使撚死班Enginee 仔

「
xxxxxview, 最近爆左單野, 話說某間酒店同佢買 Cisco Main, 年年比足錢, 但是 Macrovxxx 冇同 Cisco 買, 變相自己白袋左筆錢 ... 最近間酒店轉 Vendor 先發現原來一直都冇同 Cisco 買 Main. 最後出 Legal 告 9 佢 ...

呢間正一仆街來, Sale 屎十問九唔應, E-mail 唔復, 甚至搵佢續 Main 都唔理我 ... 好明顯睇唔上我呢 D 細公司, 人手唔夠, 真係盞做死下面班細 ...

不過下面班細幾好, 落 case, 比埋 S/N, 幾個鐘內就有人復 ... 起碼都叫做有人跟下, 有人比我屌下 ...
」

------------------------------廣告3: WTC----------------------------------------------------
FG 14.5K

本身9月簽合約就寫9點30既 。
後尾10月發現全部人都有啲遠 成日塞車
所以改個個都可以彈性翻。

後尾2月底佢就改policy 冇出信 亦冇提過幾多封信就即炒。最嬲既係 我唔想冇得彈性翻 就4月13號遞左信 預5月12日走。 點知佢叫我幫佢趕工 話個客急住要
整好哂 比埋個客4月26號 叫我入去傾 話 因為我之前遲到 所以家陣就即時解僱

本身我地關係好好 。又約哂4月27號睇復仇者4
大佬啊 入職果陣又話對員工好 家陣好似坐監咁
拍卡遲一秒就警告信

我地個個都係佢識既人介紹入黎做。
所以冇咩街外人會入去做 一黎公司係jobdbs個post
好肉酸 一定唔會吸引到人。

同埋最近得知 上一位炒果個同事同老細反映
其中一個一開公司就係到既員工成日唔做野 ，又蛇王又射波。第二日就比人出通知解僱 。

諗翻起我遞完信佢仲扮好人叫我去飲咖啡傾計
佢問我有咩做得開心 唔開心 對公司家陣環境點
我都有講果個員工唔做嘢 其實好影響士氣

之後佢就叫我努力拍爛檔 夜晚趕埋份pj 月底要出街
交好哂 即炒88

[IT撚入]九龍塘某間IT公司,下個月再係咁我告鳩你
https://lihkg.com/thread/1218929/page/1

https://medium.com/@p5d12000/工程師應該放心大膽地創造技術負債-a8022d85810
身為軟體工程師，你應該放心大膽地創造技術負債。這麼做唯一的風險，就只有在你換工作的時候，也會接手一大筆前人留下來的技術負債。不過，這種事情反正也早就已經發生了。

[連卡佛] 減人工20-50% 留定唔留
https://lihkg.com/thread/1974914/page/1?post=1

大部分唔係串你 係串啲宣傳誇張既bootcamp 小部分係串你 半信半疑啲同傳銷無分別既bootcamp
你完全唔識CS唔係問題 我都完全唔識文學評論 呢啲唔係咩羞恥既事
但係對on9傳銷野 我就一定重語氣屌 就好似如果有人on99唔識股票但係諗住借錢買牛熊 我都會串到佢仆街
你可能覺得 bootcamp又唔係家破人亡既野 駛唔駛咁串
但對我黎講 繼續留呢啲垃圾bootcamp 一黎繼續吸人血 二黎搞到個行業污煙漳氣

至於bootcamp具體點解垃圾
軟件工程係需要系統式訓練 唔係話做四個月狂操就得
叫得工程 係真係需要工程專業道德 尤其係你會唔會驚自己做錯所帶黎既後果
例如 前排機場個空管系統 可以垃圾到要幾粒鐘reboot一次 如果再錯多啲 撞機死幾百條命點撚算
波音個軟件系統 加新feature個時考慮少左野 crash左幾部飛機
就算唔係咁關鍵既軟件 我地諗下金融業既軟件 寫錯粒variable 都已經可以令公司蝕幾十粒 如果你做証券行既 間公司破產連帶啲傻散家破人亡 跳樓燒碳幾戶
一係你就做最基本個啲 寫下website仔 幫政府垃圾砌下爛code show個系統繁忙咩都唔做 咁你就連15星期bootcamp都唔需要

同埋啲bootcamp全部都overprice 因為自學都可以有更高質素既免費教材
YouTube 去大學旁聽 上網海盜大學教科書
大把路你唔行 係都要進貢啲錢比垃圾bootcamp
有冇諗過人地比錢洗comment 有冇諗過人地好似補習社咁收啲本身有料既學生然後輕鬆有出路 其他無出路既就提都唔提

老實講 你要學野既 連登大把IT狗扮工無野做 會覆你
你寫code寫唔順既 大把人教你 或者比link你
你要問bootcamp野 我就實反對既
你要開始學programming既 而家 立刻 去裝個gcc寫hello world 停止一切search bootcamp既行為

quote.msg:
大部分唔係串你 係串啲宣傳誇張既bootcamp 小部分係串你 半信半疑啲同傳銷無分別既bootcamp
你完全唔識CS唔係問題 我都完全唔識文學評論 呢啲唔係咩羞恥既事
但係對on9傳銷野 我就一定重語氣屌 就好似如果有人on99唔識股票但係諗住借錢買牛熊 我都會串到佢仆街
你可能覺得 bootcamp又唔係家破人亡既野 駛唔駛咁串
但對我黎講 繼續留呢啲垃圾bootcamp 一黎繼續吸人血 二黎搞到個行業污煙漳氣

至於bootcamp具體點解垃圾
軟件工程係需要系統式訓練 唔係話做四個月狂操就得
叫得工程 係真係需要工程專業道德 尤其係你會唔會驚自己做錯所帶黎既後果
例如 前排機場個空管系統 可以垃圾到要幾粒鐘reboot一次 如果再錯多啲 撞機死幾百條命點撚算
波音個軟件系統 加新feature個時考慮少左野 crash左幾部飛機
就算唔係咁關鍵既軟件 我地諗下金融業既軟件 寫錯粒variable 都已經可以令公司蝕幾十粒 如果你做証券行既 間公司破產連帶啲傻散家破人亡 跳樓燒碳幾戶
一係你就做最基本個啲 寫下website仔 幫政府垃圾砌下爛code show個系統繁忙咩都唔做 咁你就連15星期bootcamp都唔需要

同埋啲bootcamp全部都overprice 因為自學都可以有更高質素既免費教材
YouTube 去大學旁聽 上網海盜大學教科書
大把路你唔行 係都要進貢啲錢比垃圾bootcamp
有冇諗過人地比錢洗comment 有冇諗過人地好似補習社咁收啲本身有料既學生然後輕鬆有出路 其他無出路既就提都唔提

老實講 你要學野既 連登大把IT狗扮工無野做 會覆你
你寫code寫唔順既 大把人教你 或者比link你
你要問bootcamp野 我就實反對既
你要開始學programming既 而家 立刻 去裝個gcc寫hello world 停止一切search bootcamp既行為

quote.msg:
話說啱啱睇緊 cpu cache 啲嘢
其實有冇得 c++ code 嗰度指明個 cpu load 某個 adress 果陣唔使 入 cache
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/851286/how-to-use-movntdqa-to-avoid-cache-pollution

replies.msg:
One reason why we want to bypass the caches is that we know the data we are processing is not going to be reused soon. For example, we need to copy hundreds of MBs from one array to another. The size of the data is much bigger than the caches. Typically L1 is ~64K, L2 is a few hundred KBs and L3 is a few MBs. If the copying goes through the caches, at the end of copying last parts of the arrays will flood all levels of cache, and evict other data that may have better locality than the arrays. In other words, our streaming data pollute the caches. To avoid this, many modern CPUs support non-temporal load and store. Note that the CPU may still use a very small buffer to support non-temporal memory operation, the buffer looks like a very tiny dedicated cache. So you are not really writing to RAM from the register. This is done so that a CPU can combine writes to fully utilize the memory bus. Non temporal memory read is the same.

If you really don't want any buffering, you can change cacheability attributes in your memory mapping (i.e. page table entries). This is usually done by the OS for device drivers.

replies.msg:
Have you ever implemented your own memcpy() at work?

There are other tricks you can play with caches. For example some CPUs have instructions that create cache lines out of thin air.

https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/ssw_aix_71/assembler/idalangref_dcbz_instrs.html

The IBM architecture is nice to specify the cache line contents to be all zeros. I have used a similar instruction on another CPU that creates a cache line with garbage (previous data of the cache line). Garbage is okay for destination of copy.

The reason for these instructions to exist is to avoid reading a cache line that is going to be overwritten soon. This is the case for a write-back cache.

Have you ever implemented your own memcpy() at work?

There are other tricks you can play with caches. For example some CPUs have instructions that create cache lines out of thin air.

https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/ssw_aix_71/assembler/idalangref_dcbz_instrs.html

The IBM architecture is nice to specify the cache line contents to be all zeros. I have used a similar instruction on another CPU that creates a cache line with garbage (previous data of the cache line). Garbage is okay for destination of copy.

The reason for these instructions to exist is to avoid reading a cache line that is going to be overwritten soon. This is the case for a write-back cache.

話說啱啱睇緊 cpu cache 啲嘢
其實有冇得 c++ code 嗰度指明個 cpu load 某個 adress 果陣唔使 入 cache
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/851286/how-to-use-movntdqa-to-avoid-cache-pollution

One reason why we want to bypass the caches is that we know the data we are processing is not going to be reused soon. For example, we need to copy hundreds of MBs from one array to another. The size of the data is much bigger than the caches. Typically L1 is ~64K, L2 is a few hundred KBs and L3 is a few MBs. If the copying goes through the caches, at the end of copying last parts of the arrays will flood all levels of cache, and evict other data that may have better locality than the arrays. In other words, our streaming data pollute the caches. To avoid this, many modern CPUs support non-temporal load and store. Note that the CPU may still use a very small buffer to support non-temporal memory operation, the buffer looks like a very tiny dedicated cache. So you are not really writing to RAM from the register. This is done so that a CPU can combine writes to fully utilize the memory bus. Non temporal memory read is the same.

If you really don't want any buffering, you can change cacheability attributes in your memory mapping (i.e. page table entries). This is usually done by the OS for device drivers.

Copy 只係一個簡單例子。Non temporal load/store 主要作用係做streaming operation。例如一個array嘅每一個element + 42後放落另一個array。DMA engine可以做copy但再複雜D嘅野應該做唔到。

另外新x86有string op optimization。memcpy可以用rep movsb。表面上係一個byte一個byte copy但實際係俾CPU去決定用邊種方法去copy。CPU唔一定要一次讀一個byte。

replies.msg:
JVM 唔熟，Sorry。我寫開C/C++。memory fleece係乜？Google完都無野講memory fleece。

JIT會唔會做non temporal cache optimization唔清楚。不過non temporal load/store唔一定會好過普通load/store，例如glibc嘅SSE3 optimized memcpy係只會copy size大過shared cache嘅一半先會用non temporal load store。

https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=blob;f=sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memcpy-ssse3.S;h=d954d2765bbdcec95dd576584efb7d8c2fca93cf;hb=HEAD#l120

JIT有好處係有runtime information，可以做value profiling嚟決定某一copy係唔係通常到係好大，值得用temporal load store，不過如果真係好大，就咁call library個memcpy由library決定都可以。個block size夠大，memcpy之前花時間去決定最好方法嘅成本好少。相反如果block size同常好細，JIT可以唔call library用rep movsb或loop會快過call library。

quote.msg:
Copy 只係一個簡單例子。Non temporal load/store 主要作用係做streaming operation。例如一個array嘅每一個element + 42後放落另一個array。DMA engine可以做copy但再複雜D嘅野應該做唔到。

另外新x86有string op optimization。memcpy可以用rep movsb。表面上係一個byte一個byte copy但實際係俾CPU去決定用邊種方法去copy。CPU唔一定要一次讀一個byte。

Memory fence(memory barrier)唔係咁用個喎。
係prevent compiler 做optimization / cpu out of order execution確保memory既內容，通常加喺d 底層sync logic度。

replies.msg: BTW通常要optimize concurrent code時係諗點樣減少用memory barrier或用過弱啲嘅barrier。Barrier嘅作用係保證結果正確，唔係提高效率。

JVM 唔熟，Sorry。我寫開C/C++。memory fleece係乜？Google完都無野講memory fleece。

JIT會唔會做non temporal cache optimization唔清楚。不過non temporal load/store唔一定會好過普通load/store，例如glibc嘅SSE3 optimized memcpy係只會copy size大過shared cache嘅一半先會用non temporal load store。

https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=blob;f=sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memcpy-ssse3.S;h=d954d2765bbdcec95dd576584efb7d8c2fca93cf;hb=HEAD#l120

JIT有好處係有runtime information，可以做value profiling嚟決定某一copy係唔係通常到係好大，值得用temporal load store，不過如果真係好大，就咁call library個memcpy由library決定都可以。個block size夠大，memcpy之前花時間去決定最好方法嘅成本好少。相反如果block size同常好細，JIT可以唔call library用rep movsb或loop會快過call library。

replies.msg: Java我唔熟不過好似好多野都無得直接控制，要做到low latency我估好難（利申：Java識寫hello world咁多）。你要好小心個garbage collector無 會block住個program得太耐。另外如果係NUMA system，你由一個socket嘅CPU read另外一個socket嘅RAM會係好耐。如果你有shared data structures我唔知你個JVM識唔識optimize thread嘅CPU binding，定係Java有辦法好似C++咁可以話邊條thread bind去邊個core到。

quote.msg: Java我唔熟不過好似好多野都無得直接控制，要做到low latency我估好難（利申：Java識寫hello world咁多）。你要好小心個garbage collector無 會block住個program得太耐。另外如果係NUMA system，你由一個socket嘅CPU read另外一個socket嘅RAM會係好耐。如果你有shared data structures我唔知你個JVM識唔識optimize thread嘅CPU binding，定係Java有辦法好似C++咁可以話邊條thread bind去邊個core到。

replies.msg:
兩樣嘢：
第一NUMA系統RAM會分散響唔同NUMA domain，簡單嘅係一個CPU socket一個domain，但亦有CPU係同socket都有多個一個domain。如果CPU core要讀唔響自己domain嘅RAM，除RAM latency外還要加埋intersocket latency。呢個係memory access嘅worst case。

如果你嘅data響RAM，例如好大嘅hash table。而你嘅thread同hash table響唔同NUMA domain咁每一次讀RAM時都要cross socket。

第二個問題係cross socket cache traffic。如果你有個data俾thread A改咗，data會響thread A個core嘅L1 cache，當有另一個socket嘅thread B要讀/寫同一條cache line時，thread B要去另一個socket去read cache line。如果你有globally shared data，例如一個global lock。個lock條cache line會響不同socket之間ping pong。

replies.msg:
TL;DR you should not treat C as portable assembly anymore.

C is no longer portable assembly because compilers are so smart today. C compilers can generate code that looks very different from what programmers expect as long as the semantics is the same according to language specifications. A few examples:

1. Optimizing compilers do loop transformation. A simple for loop can be unrolled and peeled.

2. With SIMD instructions available on all major CPUs, most compilers do vectorization. A Loop can be transformed into equivalent using vector instructions. With 1), a simple C loops in a few lines can be compiled into many hundreds of instructions because the compiler aggressively unrolls and vectorizes the loop.

3. Compilers recognize some common code patterns can replace those with calls to run-time library functions. If you write a loop to copy memory, the compiler may replace that with a call to memcpy(). Question: what if I am implementing my own memcpy() in C?

4. Compilers take advantage of undefined behaviours in language specifications. It can do anything, including deleting your code in your back if you write code with undefined behaviours. For example, you should not check integer overflow in C using "if (x + 1 < x) { /* overflow */}". Your compiler can delete the whole thing without notice.

replies.msg:
You can turn off all optimizations with a command line flag like -O0 or turn off individual optimization.

You don't want to turn off optimizations normally as you are going to drop tonnes of performance if you do so. I do low-level system programming for a living and I write assembly very rarely. If I do, I prefer embedding code inside C/C++ code instead of writing in pure assembly.

replies.msg:
C Is Not a Low-level Language
Your computer is not a fast PDP-11.

David Chisnall

In the wake of the recent Meltdown and Spectre vulnerabilities, it's worth spending some time looking at root causes. Both of these vulnerabilities involved processors speculatively executing instructions past some kind of access check and allowing the attacker to observe the results via a side channel. The features that led to these vulnerabilities, along with several others, were added to let C programmers continue to believe they were programming in a low-level language, when this hasn't been the case for decades.

The features that led to these vulnerabilities, along with several others, were added to let C programmers continue to believe they were programming in a low-level language, when this hasn't been the case for decades.

TL;DR you should not treat C as portable assembly anymore.

C is no longer portable assembly because compilers are so smart today. C compilers can generate code that looks very different from what programmers expect as long as the semantics is the same according to language specifications. A few examples:

1. Optimizing compilers do loop transformation. A simple for loop can be unrolled and peeled.

2. With SIMD instructions available on all major CPUs, most compilers do vectorization. A Loop can be transformed into equivalent using vector instructions. With 1), a simple C loops in a few lines can be compiled into many hundreds of instructions because the compiler aggressively unrolls and vectorizes the loop.

3. Compilers recognize some common code patterns can replace those with calls to run-time library functions. If you write a loop to copy memory, the compiler may replace that with a call to memcpy(). Question: what if I am implementing my own memcpy() in C?

4. Compilers take advantage of undefined behaviours in language specifications. It can do anything, including deleting your code in your back if you write code with undefined behaviours. For example, you should not check integer overflow in C using "if (x + 1 < x) { /* overflow */}". Your compiler can delete the whole thing without notice.

replies.msg:
There are two ways to use SIMD.

1) You code explicitly for SIMD. For example:

http://www.cs.columbia.edu/~kar/pubsk/simd.pdf

This tends to get the best possible performance at the expense of portability. For example, you may have different versions of the same function for x86, POWER and ARM. You may event have different versions for different levels of the same ISA, like MMX, SSE and AVX on the x86. There are libraries to abstract away common SIMD primitives on different processors like load/store and basic arithmetics to avoid multiple versions but you give up some platforms specific primitives that may give up substantial performance advantage.

2) You code in generic C/C++ and let a compiler to extract parallelism in your code and convert some operations into SIMD. Most compilers today know how to do that. If you write your database engine in C/C++ and compile that with gcc or clang then you are very likely to find some SIMD usage in the compiled executable.
